tool.name: OpenSwathAssayGenerator
tool.description: Generates assays according to different models for a specific TraML
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && #if $swath_windows_file: mkdir swath_windows_file && ln -s '$swath_windows_file' 'swath_windows_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $swath_windows_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($swath_windows_file.ext)' && #end if #if $unimod_file: mkdir unimod_file && ln -s '$unimod_file' 'unimod_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $unimod_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($unimod_file.ext)' && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${out_type}' #if $swath_windows_file: -swath_windows_file 'swath_windows_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $swath_windows_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($swath_windows_file.ext)' #end if #if $unimod_file: -unimod_file 'unimod_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $unimod_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($unimod_file.ext)' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: Input file
Output file type -- default: determined from file extension or content
minimal number of transitions
maximal number of transitions
allowed fragment types
allowed fragment charge states
set this flag if specific neutral losses for detection fragment ions should be allowed
set this flag if unspecific neutral losses (H2O1, H3N1, C1H2N2, C1H2N1O1) for detection fragment ions should be allowed
MZ threshold in Thomson for precursor ion selection
lower MZ limit for precursor ions
upper MZ limit for precursor ions
MZ threshold in Thomson for fragment ion annotation
lower MZ limit for fragment ions
upper MZ limit for fragment ions
Tab separated file containing the SWATH windows for exclusion of fragment ions falling into the precursor isolation window: lower_offset upper_offset \newline 400 425 \newline
param.help: Note that the first line is a header and will be skipped select txt data sets(s)

param.label: (Modified) Unimod XML file (http://www.unimod.org/xml/unimod.xml) describing residue modifiability
IPF: set this flag if identification transitions should be generated for IPF
IPF: maximum number of site-localization permutations
IPF: set this flag if MS2-level precursor ions for identification should not be allowed for extraction of the precursor signal from the fragment ion data (MS2-level)
IPF: set this flag if specific neutral losses for identification fragment ions should not be allowed
IPF: set this flag if unspecific neutral losses (H2O1, H3N1, C1H2N2, C1H2N1O1) for identification fragment ions should be allowed
IPF: set this flag if identification transitions without precursor specificity
param.help: (i.e. across whole precursor isolation window instead of precursor MZ) should be generated

param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Generates assays according to different models for a specific TraML
